intro: Elatostema lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Elatostema lanceolatum is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
